item.title: Microsoft's arrogance
item.dc:creator: av3nger
item.description:
Ramirezoid:

He’s right, though. It seems like the only people still playing PC FPS games are Valvefags and people that still play anything by id software.

So you are deliberately telling me you think people who play valve games are fags? What the hell? Unless you are talking about the little 5 year olds who play the games I’m fine with you saying that. But what would you be thinking to insult valve fans on a Half-Life 2 engine mod forum. Wow, considering you are a fan yourself…or a Troll. And if your whole statement is just a joke, people are obviously going to take it the wrong way and you have tagged yourself to get flamed. How in the HELL did you NOT get flamed? Lucky as hell. And of course…that wouldn’t happen because the rules of the internet are mind fucked like everything that is G-Man.

Read full topic

item.title: Microsoft's arrogance
item.dc:creator: BaTz281
item.description:
Maxey:

garthbartin and ODB are the two sides of the extreme fanboyish coin.

Just to make it clear, I’d love if we returned to a state where PC and console gaming were equally successful and each one didn’t overlap or compete over each other.

This.

I’ve played on (almost) every console from Telstar up through PS3, and I still don’t feel comfortable playing FPS on a console. Doesn’t mean I haven’t done it (Medal of Honor, Halo, Red Faction, Black, etc.) but I’d rather not do it. Fighting, racing, driving (more Spyhunter than Forza), wrestling, third person action (MGS) - those are all fine with a console, and I would rather play them on a console than a PC. But first person shooters and third person RPGs (Diablo, Torchlight, etc) will stay on my PC.

If you look at this “argument” on the broad level, there are two categories - Consoles and Computers. However, computers don’t break down into as many subcategories as consoles. Example - if I own an Xbox 360 and I want to play Metal Gear Solid 4, I have to buy a PS3, end of story. But if I own a PC and want to play a PC game…I just do it - there is no “PC Sub-category exclusivity” unless you look at Operating System requirements, which still isn’t as bad as buying a whole new friggin’ console.

To be sure, game PC requirements can suck, but things (i.e. hardware) will always escalate. At least with a computer, I can yank a part or two out, replace them, and be able to play any game for another 2-4 years PLUS it’s still a computer that lets me browse the Web, burn CDs, write programs, etc. With a console, it’s generation based - you want the new game? Drop $300-400 on the new console, plus games, plus peripherals, plus Xbox Live!, plus DLC, plus INSERT USELESS PURCHASE HERE. And the best you’ll get out of a console for multi-purpose is maybe playing DVDs, streaming media, and limited web browsing (oh yeah - because I want to troll Facebook while playing my Xbox).

I’m not a PC fag, and I’m not a console fag - each one has their place, but neither should die, and as already mentioned a few times, players on one shouldn’t suffer because of the other (i.e. terrible console-to-PC ports).

Read full topic

item.title: Microsoft's arrogance
item.dc:creator: Surplus
item.description:
Ignoring the rest of this thread I would like to say this.

PC gaming will never die as long as there are people wanting to game on PCs. Thus PC FPS will never die as long a s PC gaming is around.

The upstart in FPS on consoles is only really do to a shift in gamers tastes. FPS has had a boom in popularity of the last ten years.

However judging the heart beat of FPS on a lack of major PC exclusives is stupid. With developers wanting to make as much money as possible and being bigger to develop for more platforms exclusives as a whole are dying out. The only reason they are still here is the console wars wanting that extra thing to encourage people to buy their console not the other and even this is becoming rarer because 3rd party developers are asking more and more for them.

TL;DR PC FPS hasn’t gone anywhere, Consoles players have acquired a taste for FPS.

Read full topic

item.title: Microsoft's arrogance

item.description:
DrGonzo:

I loved the Valvefag comment, not only is it homophobic, it’s just stupid. I am a console gamer and a PC gamer. I still always buy shooters on the PC and racing games etc on console. There is absolutely no statistical evidence the PC is dieing.

Succesful troll: confirmed.
And by the way. Homophobic? You pretty much called it on yourself right now.

Niathaur:

stuff

That’s like the quintessential elitist comment.

Read full topic

item.title: Microsoft's arrogance
item.dc:creator: DrGonzo
item.description:
I loved the Valvefag comment, not only is it homophobic, it’s just stupid. I am a console gamer and a PC gamer. I still always buy shooters on the PC and racing games etc on console. There is absolutely no statistical evidence the PC is dieing.

Yes it is true that FPS’s are now big on consoles, and naturally consoles outsell PC games as they ALWAYS have. So we can come to the conclusion that FPS’s sell more on consoles than on PC. But that is a completely different situation to saying that the FPS is dead on Pc or anything along those lines. According to Steam statistics the FPS is actually healthier on Pc now than it has ever been.

Edit- Another thought is that there hasn’t been any interesting developments in the FPS in probably 10 years or so, this is probably due to consoles and their obsession with what is essentially just Team Deathmatch multiplayer modes. Where we Pc gamers got our fill of that in the early 90s, to our simple console friends this whole multiplayer thing is new. Oh and what Niataur said, living with a Mac owning Xbox playing flatmate, I can comfirm their intelligence levels are rather low.

Read full topic
